thread.title: Title contenders eyeing win at Charlotte to ease pressure
thread.title_full: Title contenders eyeing win at Charlotte to ease pressure - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Jenna Fryer, Ap Auto Racing Writer
title: Title contenders eyeing win at Charlotte to ease pressure
text: Photo: Bob Jordan, AP Kevin Harvick looks under his car during during practice for Saturday's NASCAR Sprint Cup series auto race at Charlotte Motor Speedway in Concord, N.C., Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. Kevin Harvick looks under his car during during practice for... CONCORD, N.C. (AP) — Expect the intensity to pick up a tick in the opening race of the second round of NASCAR's playoffs. The event at Charlotte Motor Speedway ended last year with mild-mannered Matt Kenseth jumping Brad Keselowski, who had already drawn the ire of Denny Hamlin. Kevin Harvick looks under his car during during practice for Saturday's NASCAR Sprint Cup series auto race at Charlotte Motor Speedway in Concord, N.C., Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.
